Detailed Description

The USBHIDDevice class.

The USBHIDDevice can be used to communicate with a USB HID Device.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

USBHIDDevice::USBHIDDevice ( unsigned short  vendor_id = 0x181b,
unsigned short  product_id = 0x4002,
QObject *  parent = 0 
)

The USBHIDDevice constructor.

The vendor_id should be set to the Vendor ID of the USB HID Device, the product_id should be set to the Product ID of the USB HID Device. You do not need to specify the parent object, the StimulGL script engine automatically retrieves the parent role

USBHIDDevice::~USBHIDDevice ( )

The USBHIDDevice destructor.

You do not need call the destructor. The StimulGL script engine automatically performs the garbage collection after you set the object to NULL and the script ends

Member Function Documentation

bool USBHIDDevice::Calibrate ( ) [slot]

Starts a Calibration wizard for an easy calibration for the current USB HID Device. Returns true if the calibration was successful and accepted by the user.

void USBHIDDevice::CalibrateThreadStarted ( QString  DateTimeStamp) [signal]

The CalibrateThreadStarted Signal.

You can use this Signal for receiving a notification when the capture thread calibration is started. Parameter DateTimeStamp holds the date/time of when the generate thread calibration started.

void USBHIDDevice::CalibrateThreadStopped ( QString  DateTimeStamp) [signal]

The CalibrateThreadStopped Signal.

You can use this Signal for receiving a notification when the capture thread calibration is stopped. Parameter DateTimeStamp holds the date/time of when the generate thread calibration stopped.

void USBHIDDevice::CaptureThreadButtonTriggered ( unsigned char  NewValue,
unsigned char  ChangedBits 
) [signal]

The CaptureThreadButtonTriggered Signal.

This signal is generated when the capture thread detects a change in the Buttons. NewValue holds the new value of the Buttons after the change was detected, ChangedBits holds a mask of the Button-bits that changed value.

void USBHIDDevice::CaptureThreadJoystickChanged ( int  Xpos,
int  Ypos 
) [signal]

The CaptureThreadJoystickChanged Signal.

This signal is generated when the capture thread detects a change in the X,Y position of the Joystick. The Xpos and Ypos hold the last value of the Joystick when the change was detected.

void USBHIDDevice::CaptureThreadStarted ( QString  DateTimeStamp) [signal]

The CaptureThreadStarted Signal.

You can use this Signal for receiving a notification when the capture thread is started. Parameter DateTimeStamp holds the date/time of when the generate thread started.

void USBHIDDevice::CaptureThreadStopped ( QString  DateTimeStamp) [signal]

The CaptureThreadStopped Signal.

You can use this Signal for receiving a notification when the capture thread is stopped. Parameter DateTimeStamp holds the date/time of when the generate thread stopped.

void USBHIDDevice::ConfigureHIDFiltering ( bool  bActivateJoystickStabilisation,
int  nJoystickStabilisationThreshold,
bool  bActivateJoystickHistory,
int  nJoystickHistorySize 
) [slot]

For configuring the current HID Device Joystick Position Filtering for the capture thread.

Parameters:
bActivateJoystickStabilisationwhether the Joystick Stabilizing filter should be enabled during a capture thread.
nJoystickStabilisationThresholdthe threshold for the Joystick Stabilizing filter during a capture thread.
bActivateJoystickHistorywhether the Joystick History (LowPass) filter should be enabled during a capture thread.
nJoystickHistorySizethe size for the Joystick History (LowPass) filter during a capture thread.
void USBHIDDevice::ConfigureHIDTriggers ( bool  bActivateJoystickTrigger,
bool  bActivateButtonTriggers,
unsigned char  cButtonMask,
short  sButtonDetectCaptureMethod 
) [slot]

For configuring the current HID Device Joystick Triggers for the capture thread.

Parameters:
bActivateJoystickTriggerdetermines whether the Joysticks position changes should be used/captured during a capture thread.
bActivateButtonTriggersdetermines whether the Joysticks button changes should be used/captured during a capture thread.
cButtonMaska bit-mask pattern (one byte) representing which bits(buttons) should be taken into account during the capture thread.
sButtonDetectCaptureMethodthe capture detection method to use(see the USBHIDDeviceNameSpace::CaptureMethod).
void USBHIDDevice::EmulateHIDMouse ( bool  bEnable,
bool  bFullScreenMode,
bool  bEnableLeftMouse = false,
bool  bEnableRightMouse = false 
) [slot]

For configuring the Mouse Emulation feature of the current HID Device Joystick during a capture thread.

Parameters:
bEnablewhether the Mouse Emulation should be enabled (or disabled) for the capture thread.
bFullScreenModewhether the Mouse Emulation should be performed in Full Screen Mode (or not) for the capture thread.
bEnableLeftMousewhether the Left Mouse button should be emulated during the Mouse Emulation of capture thread.
bEnableRightMousewhether the Right Mouse button should be emulated during the Mouse Emulation of capture thread.
void USBHIDDevice::ResetCalibrationData ( ) [slot]

Resets the internal calibration data for the current USB HID Device.

void USBHIDDevice::SetProductID ( unsigned short  product_id) [slot]

Sets the Product ID for the USB HID Device.

void USBHIDDevice::SetVendorID ( unsigned short  vendor_id) [slot]

Sets the Vendor ID for the USB HID Device.

bool USBHIDDevice::StartCaptureThread ( bool  bIsCalibrationThread = false) [slot]

For starting a new USBHIDDevice Capture thread, only one instance can be active at the same moment.

Parameters:
bIsCalibrationThreadwhether the internal calibration data should be automatically updated (or not) if needed.
Returns:
Whether the capture thread could be successfully started.
See also:
StopCaptureThread()
void USBHIDDevice::StopCaptureThread ( bool  bWasCalibrationThread = false) [slot]

Stops the Capture Thread(if started), see StartCaptureThread.

void USBHIDDevice::WriteCapturedDataToFile ( bool  bWriteToFile,
QString  qsFileName,
bool  bWriteHeaderInfo,
bool  bWriteCalibratedData 
) [slot]

For configuring the logging of the captured data.

Parameters:
bWriteToFilewhether the captured data should be written to a file (or not) during the capture thread.
qsFileNamethe file-name of the file where the captured data is written to during the capture thread.
bWriteHeaderInfowhether a header (first line in file) before the captured data should be written to a file (or not) during the capture thread.
bWriteCalibratedDatawhether the calibrated (or raw) captured data should be written to a file during the capture thread.
